Boston.com
10

State board suspends pension for DiMasi friend

The state retirement board voted to stop lobbyist Richard W. McDonough's pension payments, saying there was no evidence he did full-time public work. (Globe, 12:34 p.m.)

BU to investigate hockey team culture after sex charges against players

Boston University is forming a task force to investigate its ice hockey team in the wake of two players' recent arrests on charges of sexual assault. (Globe, 1:22 p.m.)
  • 2/21 BU hockey player pleads not guilty to rape
  • Vennochi: BU hockey needs to change jock culture

Key witness in Mattapan slaying says he's testifying because woman, child slain

Kimani Washington testifies

Kimani Washington said he testified against his cousin and friend because a mother and child were "innocent victims" who shouldn't have been killed. (Globe, 1:35 p.m.)

Patrick 'done' with Murray crash queries

Governor Patrick today proclaimed himself "done" with questions about the crash, saying he spoke to his No. 2 and is satisfied of no wrongdoing. (Globe, 11:49 a.m.)

Obama apologizes for Koran burnings; Afghan soldier kills two US troops

President Obama apologized for recent Koran burnings at a US base, as violent protests led a man dressed in an Afghan uniform to kill two US troops. (AP, 11:19 a.m.)

Today's warmth to give way to rain, snow

Clouds moving in tonight may cause rain in areas south of the Massachusetts Turnpike. Northern parts of the state may see snow, forecasters said. (Globe, 1:30 p.m.)
